intro: Gilia dichotoma var. uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom in late summer. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
